Summary: Your project title
Proposal/progress presentation
list your team members’ full name (as in your course registration) . team members must be able to identify their full name if they are a part of your team .
this template lists the key questions that we would like to know in the proposal/progress presentation . Feel free to modify its template format (e.g., font color, size, decoration)
Project highlights
Project sponsor
Is this project proposed by yourselves or by any company? if so, how much money will it take to complete the project?
if it is sponsored by the company, what support (e.g., real-world datasets, domain knowledge, etc.) do they provide?
Business problem statement
Describe the business problem that you will investigate . if it is a business problem, what is the problem?
Why is it interesting and useful?
What is its impact on Singapore?
Technical problem statement
what is the technical problem statement to address the business problem of this project? what is a technical solution to the problem of the project?
example: Entrance access control is a business problem . face recognition is technical problem; fingerprint recognition a technical one .
Related work
Dataset
what dataset are you using? Do you use public datasets or collect them yourself? do you use datasets from other sources or do you collect them?
if you use a dataset, have you downloaded it? have you sought permission from the dataset owner (e.g., request form)?
if it needs to be collected by yourself, how do you plan to collect it? use your own phone to record, grab it from the Internet, etc.
how much data (# categories, # records, etc.) do you plan to use in this project? if not, how much of the data will you be using?
Proposed technical approach
you are encouraged to draw a flowchart to illustrate your proposed technical approach . cnn.com's ireport.com has a complete list of contributors and contributors .
in your drawing, please clarify which module uses pre-trained models . highlight which module is developed by you (i.e., your efforts for this project).
you can use references (e.g., GitHub references) so that you don’t need to develop everything from the scratch . please clarify what is borrowed from references and what is developed by yourselves .
Experimental design
How will you evaluate your developed system?
what is your experimental setup (e.g., using a benchmark dataset, setting up a prototype, etc)?
you might need to consider technical metrics (e.g., accuracy, etc) or business metrics . reduction of manual process time, etc., might also be considered .
Project deliverables

what are the final project deliverables? for example, an entrance access control system with face detection (existing OpenCV), face recognition (pre-trained model), and facial mask detection (new component developed in this project).
for example, a system processes photos (jpg file) from a dataset . a simple website for the user to upload a file, or a recorded video (mp4 file)
a mockup can be used to illustrate your project deliverables . you can use the mockup to demonstrate your deliverable .
Team members’ responsibility
split the project deliverables among your team members . you can clarify how you plan to split the deliveryables .
this table is used to evaluate whether your project scope is either too heavy or too light according to your team size .
Team member Project responsibility A B C D E E Team member Team Member Project responsibility E E E A B E E B E C E E
Progress
Use one slide to list the progress that has been done . use one slide if you want to see the progress made .
